meanings.definition: An object believed to bring good luck or protection.
meanings.sent1: She always carried her lucky talismans with her wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The ancient talismans were said to have magical powers.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the shiny talismans were toys and played with them.
meanings.sent4: His grandmother's talismans seemed to ward off any misfortune.
meanings.sent5: The talismans glowed softly in the moonlight, casting a protective aura.

meanings.sent1: The talismans around her neck jingled softly as she walked.
meanings.sent2: He treasured the talismans given to him by his family.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the shiny talismans and hid them in its nest.
meanings.sent4: The talismans seemed to hold a mysterious power over those who possessed them.
meanings.sent5: The ancient talismans were intricately carved with symbols of protection.
